gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਕਰਪੂਰ ਮੈ ੳੁਡਤ ਕੋ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਤਾ ਤੇ ਅੳੁਰ ਬਾਸਨਾ ਨ ਤਾ ਕੈ ਅਾਗੈ ਠਹਾਰਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Karapoor Mai Udat Ko Soubhaau Taa Tay , Aur Baasanaa N Taa Kai Aagai Tthahaaravaee ?
translation: As the fragrance of camphor has the characteristic of spreading in the air, thus its smell cannot remain lodged in anything;

gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਸੁਬਾਸ ਕੈ ਸੁਬਾਸਨਾ ਬਨਾਸਪਤੀ ਤਾਹੀ ਤੇ ਸੁਗੰਧਤਾ ਸਕਲ ਸੈ ਸਮਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Chandan Soubaas Kai Soubaasanaa Banaasapatee , Taahee Tay Sougandhataa Sakal Sai Samaavaee ?
translation: But vegetation around a Sandalwood tree become equally fragrant with the aroma released but it;

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਜਲ ਮਿਲਤ ਸ੍ਰਬੰਗ ਸੰਗ ਰੰਗੁ ਰਾਖੈ ਅਗਨ ਜਰਾੲਿ ਸਬ ਰੰਗਨੁ ਮਿਟਾਵੲੀ
transliteration: Jaisay Jal Milat Srabang Sang Rangu Raakhai , Agan Jaraai Sab Ranganu Mitaavaee ?
translation: As water acquires the same colour that is mixed in it, but fire destroys all the colours by burning them (into ashes);

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਰਵਿ ਸਸਿ ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤ ਸੁਭਾਵ ਗਤਿ ਸੰਜੋਗੀ ਬਿਓਗੀ ਦ੍ਰਿਸਟਾਤੁ ਕੈ ਦਿਖਾਵੲੀ ||੧੩੪||
transliteration: Jaisay Ravi Sasi Siv Sakat Soubhaav Gati , Sanjogee Biaogee Drisataatu Kai Dikhaavaee ?134?
translation: Just as the effect of Sun is undesirable (Tamoguni) while the moon has virtuous effect, similarly a Guru-conscious person behaves peacefully and virtuously while a self willed and apostate person caught in the evil effects of mammon is conspicuous. (134)
